question: During copulation (coitus) semen is released by the penis into the ______.
Motile sperms pass through the ______ and enter the uterus.
Sperms finally reach the ______ region of the fallopian tube.
The ovum released by the ovary is also transported to the ______ region.
Fertilisation can only occur if the ovum and sperms are transported ______ to the ampullary region.
The process of fusion of a sperm with an ovum is called ______.
During fertilisation, a sperm comes in contact with the ______ layer of the ovum.
Changes induced in the membrane block the entry of additional ______.
Secretions of the ______ help the sperm enter into the cytoplasm of the ovum.
